result.execSummary:
The defendant David Nmn Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges

supervisions.notes:
*Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Sentence credit of 4 days was granted, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid before costs or fines for Power Products, LLC.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No use or possession or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No contact with: Power Products, LLC.  Maintian employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained.  
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: With Huber.  Release for standard conditions.  STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Nmn Robinson

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant David Nmn Robinson in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.
 4 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
No contact with:  Power Products, LLC.
DNA sample to be provided.

RESTITUTION:  $6,658.39 (to be paid to Power Products, LLc - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
60 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 21, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
